statement.p: Alice invests 2200. Her investment grows according to compound interest at an annual effective interest rate of 4% for T years, at which time it has accumulated to 8000. Find T.

Elliott received an inheritance from his Aunt Ruth when she died on his fifth birthday. On his eighteenth birthday, the inheritance has grown to 32,168. If the money has been growing by compound interest at an annual effective interest rate of 6.2%, find the amount of money Aunt Ruth left to Elliott.

task.p: At an effective annual interest rate of 12%, calculate the number of years (including fractions) it will take for an investment of 1000 to accumulate to 3000.
Repeat using an effective monthly interest rate of 1%.
Suppose that an investment of 1000 accumulated to 3000 in exactly 10 years at effective annual rate of interest \iota. Calculate \iota.
Repeat using an effective monthly rate of interest j. Calculate j.

statement.p: Bill will receive 5000 at the end of each year for the next 4 years. Using an effective annual interest rate of 6%, find the present value today of all the payments Bill will receive.
Horatio invests money in an account earning compound interest at an unknown annual effective rate \iota. His money doubles in nine years. Find \iota.
It is known that 600 invested for two years will return 264 in interest. Find the accumulated value of 2000 invested at the same rate of compound interest for three years.

It is known that an investment of 500 will increase to 4000 at the end of 30 years. Find the sum of the present values of three payments of 10,000 each which will occur at the end of 20, 40, and 60 years.

Carl puts 10,000 into a bank account that pays an effective annual interest rate of 4% for ten years, with interest credited at the end of each year. If a withdrawal is made during the first five and one-half years, a penalty of 5% of the withdrawal is made. Carl withdraws K at the end of each of years 4, 5, 6, and 7. The balance in the account at the end of year 10 is 10,000. Calculate K.

Ed buys a TV from Al for 480 by paying 50 in cash, 100 every three months for one year (four payments of 100), and a final payment in 15 months (three months after the final quarterly payment). Find the amount of the final payment if Al earns a 3-month compound interest rate of 3%. What is the final payment if Al earns a one-month rate of 1%?
Kara Danvers deposits 1500 at the end of each year for 3 years. Immediately after the third payment, the balance in the account is 5100. Find the effective annual interest rate.

Mountain Bank pays interest at a rate of \iota^{(2)} = 0.15. River Bank pays interest compounded daily. What minimum nominal annual rate must River Bank pay in order to be as attractive as Mountain Bank?
Thor makes a deposit at the end of months 1, 2, and 3. Each deposit is in the amount of 1250. The account carries an interest rate of \iota^{(2)} = 0.05. What is the balance at the end of the year?

Black Widow makes a deposit at time 0. At the beginning of each quarter for the rest of the year, she withdraws 500. At the end of the year, the account is depleted. The account carries an interest rate of \iota^{(12)} = 12\\%. What was the amount of the original deposit?

Bob puts 10,000 into a bank account that has monthly compounding with interest credited at the end of each month. The monthly interest rate is 1% for the first three months of the account and after that the monthly interest rate is 0.75%. Find the balance in the account at the end of 12 months just after interest has been credited. Find the average compound monthly interest rate on the account for the 12 month period.

Unit values in a mutual fund have experienced annual growth rates of 10%, 16%, -7%, 4%, and 32% in the past five years. The fund manager suggests the fund can advertise an average annual growth of 11% over the past five years. What is the actual average annual compound growth rate over the past five years?

Sean deposits 826 in a savings account that earns interest at Increasing Rates Bank. For the first three years the money is on deposit, the annual effective interest rate is 3%. For the next two years the annual effective interest rate is 4%, and for the following five years the annual effective interest rate is 5%. What is the balance that Sean has at the end of ten years?

For a fourteen-year investment, what level annual effective rate of interest gives the same accumulation as an annual effective rate of interest of 5% for eight years followed by a monthly effective rate of interest of 0.6% for six years?
It is known that \left(1+\frac{\iota^{(n)}}{n}\right) = \frac{\left(1+\frac{\iota^{(4)}}{4}\right)}{\left(1+\frac{\iota^{(5)}}{5}\right)} Find n.

The parents of three children aged 1, 3, and 6 wish to set up a trust fund that will pay 25,000 to each child upon attainment of age 18, and 100,000 to each child upon attainment of age 21. If the trust fund will earn effective annual interest at 10%, what amount must the parents now invest in the trust fund?

A contract calls for payments of 750 every 4 months for several years. Each payment is to be replaced by two payments of 367.85 each, one to be made 2 months before, and one to be made at the time of, the original payment. Find the 2-month rate of interest implied by this proposal if the new payment scheme is financially equivalent to the old one.

The two sets of grandparents for a newborn baby wish to invest enough money immediately to pay 10,000 per year for four years toward college costs starting at age 18. Grandparents A agree to fund the first two payments, will Grandparents B agree to fund the last two payments. If the effective rate of interest is 6% per annum (per year), find the difference between the contributions of Grandparents A and B.
The sum of the present value of 1 paid at the end of n periods and 1 paid at the end of 2n periods is 1. Find (1+\iota)^{2n}.
David can receive one of the following two payment streams:

li.p: 100 at time 0, 200 at time n, and 300 at time 2n.

statement.p: At an effective annual interest rate of \iota, the present values of the two streams are equal. Given v^n = 0.75941, determine \iota.

Suppose that for the coming year inflation is forecast at an effective annual rate of r=0.15 and interest is forecast at an effective annual rate \iota = 0.10. What will be the corresponding real, inflation-adjusted rate of interest for the coming year?
A savings account earns interest at an effective rate of \iota = 0.12 on which 45% income tax is paid. If the inflation rate is 10% per year, what is the annual after-tax real rate of return?
